intro: Ageratina motozintlensis, commonly known as the Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling a ball of cotton. It is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and has adapted to thrive in arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss.
